title: Battlefield 6's Winter Offensive Update Is All About Combat Consistency And Responsiveness
description: Battlefield 6 is getting a new update called Winter Offensive on December 9, bringing a handful of combat improvements focused on reliability, consistency, and responsiveness in the shooter's various modes. Audio changes tested in a recent Battlefield Labs mini-test will be deployed with the upcoming update, with the overall aim to prioritize the most important combat and vehicle sounds. The audio refresh includes a "comprehensive pass" on footstep audio that aims to make footstep sound effects more tactically useful to players who can hear it. The update also includes some improvements towards ongoing performance issues that sometimes cause important sounds not to play as intended, an issue that's especially prevalent on large maps. Rush and Breakthrough are also getting some balance changes designed to improve the game mode's flow, and even out the win rate between attacking and defending teams. Seige of Cairo, for example, will get a few boosts to the attacking side, including one more attacker tank in Sectors 1 and 3, and an updated capture area on B. Rush attackers are also getting a small boost, with changes to M-COM locations on Manhattan Bridge and Liberation Peak. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: No Man's Sky Boss Reacts To Once Human Premium Cosmetic
description: No Man's Sky and Once Human are a pair of games that don't have a lot in common. Regardless, fans have noticed that Starry Studio, the developer behind Once Human, appear to have repurposed an asset from No Man's Sky as a premium cosmetic item. Now, Sean Murray--the head of No Man's Sky developer Hello Games--has weighed in on the similarity, even if he doesn't seem to be all that concerned about it. The similarities between No Man's Sky's base teleport module and Once Human's item were spotted by Reddit users, who noted that aside from the exercise bike and a fresh coat of paint on the latter, the two objects seem almost identical. Hey @NoMansSky @hellogames are you aware that @OnceHuman_ is selling your teams assets in game? @Gothalion https://t.co/tcjiInvEMC pic.twitter.com/UGrsVkMVeH — Atlas (@GenesisModding) December 1, 2025 Murray mentioned that both objects are missing rivets, which the Hello Games team accidentally left out of the model used when viewing the base teleport module from a distance. As far as Murray is concerned, "[the] joke's on them." Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Diablo 4 Leaderboards Delayed To 2026
description: Those waiting for the return of Diablo 4 leaderboards will have to wait a little longer, as the feature has been delayed into 2026. Blizzard announced the delay during its most recent Diablo 4 developer update livestream. The new leaderboard system revolves around a new dungeon called The Tower, where players will be able to test their builds and compete for clear times and rewards. "This is to make sure we have some stability with the season launch, and then when The Tower shows up, it's online and people are ready to tackle it," associate game director Zaven Haroutunian said regarding the reason for the delay. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: New Lord Of The Rings & The Hobbit Illustrated Box Set Restocked With Nearly 50% Discount At Amazon
description: The Hobbit & The Lord of the Rings, Illustrated by Alan Lee Box Set $78.33 (was $150) | Restocked at Amazon See at Amazon See at Walmart After selling out during its Black Friday sale, Amazon has restocked the popular new hardcover box set featuring illustrated editions of J.R.R. Tolkien's beloved fantasy novels. Published by William Morrow on October 14, The Hobbit & The Lord of the Rings Illustrated by Alan Lee Box Set is on sale for nearly 50% off at Amazon and Walmart. Tolkien fans can secure this beautiful slipcased set for only $78.33 (was $150). If you're buying it as a Christmas gift, just know that Amazon currently estimates a delivery window of December 22 to January 5, whereas Walmart will deliver the box set next week. Though not nearly as fancy as last year's The Lord of the Rings Deluxe Illustrated Box Set, it's nice to have matching editions of LOTR and The Hobbit in one set. This is especially true when talking about the iconic editions illustrated by the conceptual designer of The Lord of the Rings and The Hobbit movie trilogies. The new four-volume collection includes redesigned editions of The Lord of the Rings Centenary Edition--published in 1992 to mark 100 year since Tolkien's birth--and The Hobbit 60th Anniversary Edition (1997). Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Lego Pac-Man Arcade Machine Is $80 Off At Amazon And Walmart
description: Lego Icons: Pac-Man Arcade (2,651 Pieces) $190 (was $270) See at Amazon See at Walmart Sold out at Target Most of Amazon's Black Friday and Cyber Monday Lego deals disappeared on December 2, but a select few are still available thanks to Walmart's decision to extend its Cyber Monday sale through December 7. And Walmart's sale happens to feature the best video game-inspired Lego set from Amazon's original sale: the Pac-Man Arcade. The 2,651-piece retro arcade cabinet model is on sale for $190 (was $270) at Amazon and Walmart while supplies last. Target actually matched this deal but has since sold out. Technically, the $190 price isn't the all-time low, because Amazon sold it for $189 over the weekend, but it's close enough.. The Pac-Man Arcade launched in June 2023 and almost always sells for full price. Most previous deals sold out fast, so it's somewhat surprising Amazon and Walmart aren't out of stock like Target. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Walmart-Exclusive DualSense Icon Blue Controller Is Back In Stock For $64
description: Icon Blue Limited Edition DualSense PS5 Controller $64 (was $85) | Walmart Exclusive See at Walmart The Walmart-exclusive Icon Blue DualSense Controller is back in stock and on sale for $64 (was $85). Launched in October, this eye-catching edition of the official PlayStation controller was first discounted to $64 on November 20 when PlayStation's 2025 Holiday Sale kicked off. Walmart sold out before Black Friday weekend and then restocked it at full price--but now it's back on sale alongside other DualSense models. This deal is supposed to run through December 18, but there's no guarantee Walmart will still have units available by then. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Elden Ring: Nightreign Adds New Patch Ahead Of The Forsaken Hollows DLC
description: This week, From Software's Elden Ring Nightreign is expanding with The Forsaken Hollows DLC, which adds two new playable characters, two extra bosses, and a fresh Shifting Earth event. But if you want to play that DLC, then you'll need to add the new Nightreign Version 1.03 patch across PC and consoles. One of the primary changes in this patch is that the trigger conditions for Relic effects have been broadened. The game's passive effects have been increased, which include greater attacking power when using two-handed weapons or armaments, as well as chain attacks, charge attacks, and jump attacks. The Wrath of Gold incantation has been given a power boost, while decreasing the cost to players' FP consumption. There are a number of bug fixes in this patch as well, including one that was teleporting players to the wrong area during the Augur invasion if they were performing a critical hit at the time. Under certain conditions, players weren't able to activate Sites of Grace or Churches, but the notes say the issue has been "mitigated." Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Metroid Dread Amiibo 2-Pack Restocked At Amazon For $25
description: Metroid Dread Amiibo 2-Pack $25.31 (was $30) See at Amazon See at Walmart Another Metroid Amiibo launches this week with Metroid Prime 4: Beyond on Nintendo Switch and Switch 2. The third and final Metroid Prime 4 Amiibo, Sylux, is available to order for $30 at Amazon and other major retailers. Like other Amiibo released during the Switch 2 era, all three Metroid Prime 4 Amiibo are more expensive than collectors were used to before 2025. That's why it's refreshing to see Amazon restock the Metroid Dread Amiibo 2-Pack for $25.31 (was $30). The Dread Amiibo set isn't difficult to find for around MSRP, but it's rare to see it sold by a major retailer. Usually you need to buy it from a third-party seller, but this restock is sold and shipped by Amazon. Metroid Dread Amiibo 2-Pack $25.31 (was $30) The Metroid Dread Amiibo 2-Pack is cool for multiple reasons. For Samus fans, it's one of the few collectibles featuring the bounty hunter's regenerating Varia Suit. The blue-tinged sections on the suit are organic matter from the Fusion Suit. This directly ties back to the events of Metroid Fusion. In the 2002 Game Boy Advance game, Samus was infected by the X parasite. She received the Metroid vaccine, but when Dread starts, her Varia Suit is still in the process of regenerating to its normal form. This Samus Amiibo is cool, but the E.M.M.I. Amiibo might be cooler. One of the most unsettling enemies in franchise history, the Extraplanetary Multiform Mobile Identifier--better known as EMMI--is robot nightmare fuel. Like Samus, the EMMI Amiibo's pose matches official key art. If Amazon sells out, you can buy the Metroid Dread 2-Pack from a third-party seller on Walmart Marketplace for roughly the same price. See at Amazon See at Walmart Where to Buy Metroid Prime 4: Beyond Amiibo Metroid Prime 4: Beyond for Nintendo Switch 2 $70 | Releases December 4 Preorder at Best Buy Preorder at Amazon Preorder at Walmart Preorder at GameStop Preorder at Target Metroid Prime 4: Beyond for Nintendo Switch $60 | Releases December 4 Preorder at Best Buy Preorder at Amazon Preorder at Walmart Preorder at Target Preorder at GameStop If you haven't picked up the Metroid Prime 4: Beyond Amiibo, all three are in stock at Amazon. Samus and Samus & Vi-O-La launched November 6 for $30 and $40, respectively, and Sylux releases December 4 alongside the game. Sylux -- $30 | Dec. 4 Amazon Walmart Target Best Buy Samus & Vi-O-La -- $40 Amazon Walmart Target Best Buy Samus -- $30 Amazon Walmart Target Best Buy For more Metroid collectibles and gear: Walmart has budget-friendly action figures by Jakks Pacific; Amazon has two large Club Mocchi-Mocchi plushies inspired by Metroid Prime 4; and PowerA has Switch 2 and Switch accessories. The official Metroid Prime 4 edition of the PowerA Slim Case for Switch 2 is up for grabs for only $15 (was $20), and a Metroid Prime Trilogy Crossbody Bag is down to $20 (was $25). Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Escape From Tarkov Players Are Finally Escaping From Tarkov
description: For a game that's been in development since 2012, it was a surprise when Escape from Tarkov finally emerged from early access in November. And now that it's possible to really escape from Tarkov, someone's done it and shared the video to prove it. A streamer who goes by Tigz has been acknowledged by Battlestate Games as the first player to find a way out of Tarkov in this first-person-extraction shooter. In a post captured on Instagram, the devs wrote, "Congratulations to Tigz on being the first to Escape From Tarkov. You survived. But at what cost." The image sent to Tigz as proof of his accomplishment as the first player to escape from Tarkov.Tigz also shared the video that demonstrated how he got his character out of Tarkov alive. But if you want to skip ahead to the actual escape, advance the clip to the 43 minute mark. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Cuphead Deluxe Edition Art Book Is Over 60% Off At Amazon
description: The Art of Cuphead: The Delicious Last Course Deluxe Edition $36 (was $100) See at Amazon The Art of Cuphead: The Delicious Last Course $19.27 (was $40) See at Amazon The Art of The Cuphead Show $30.88 (was $50) See at Amazon If you're looking for a nice gift for a fan of Studio MDHR's popular run-and-gun game Cuphead, you should check out Amazon's deals on The Art of Cuphead: The Delicious Last Course. Published last fall by Dark Horse, the beautiful slipcased Deluxe Edition is on sale for only $36 (was $100) at Amazon. Alternatively, you can get the standard hardcover edition for $19.27 (was $40). Take a closer look at both editions below. These are just a few of the official Cuphead books available now; you can check out comic books, novels for young readers, and even picture books on this Amazon store page we created. We also collected all of the officially licensed Cuphead plushies available for reasonable prices, including the ultra-soft Club Mocchi-Mocchi 15-inch plush, which is a great pillow to rest against while flipping through Cuphead artwork. Continue Reading at GameSpot
